intro: Myosotis exscapa, commonly known as the sky-blue forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, blue-violet flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and has lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Myosotis exscapa is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
